pr_title: Enable read and write IO APIs to a properties file

timeline.bodyText: Let's say I have to read 2 properties file in single ballerina code. Due to this only the first reader will be successful isn't it? We have to load properties every time from the reader.
timeline.author: niveathika

replies.bodyText: No, when I test it is the other way around. Actually I added this to solve the problem that you mentioned. For example, once we read we cannot use the reader once, it is not reusable. This won't be a problem in other APIs since they read only once. From, this we store the properties statically and reuse again when we needed.
replies.author: BuddhiWathsala

replies.bodyText: Here we are not reading the properties from the same file. If we try to read 2 different files, this will read only from one of this since the Properties is a static variable.
replies.author: niveathika

timeline.author: niveathika

timeline.bodyText: Any reason to write properties using custom content rather than using Properties.store()
timeline.author: niveathika

replies.bodyText: Fixed in 61d9daa. Both are quite same, here I changed it to store() since we need to add comments if needed, as specified in the Java store() function.
replies.author: BuddhiWathsala
